labels.label:
(5) IMPORTANT:
Go to "prometheus-collector" process group. Select "RequestPrometheusAPI" and set concurrent tasks vakue to the specified value for the "events" parameter in the context

(2) Parameter context NOTES:
Set "events" parameter to the number of events sent per second to the broker. This value is calculated from the number of concurrent tasks configured at the prometheus-collector's GenerateJSONData processor, multiplied by 10 (the number of timeseries samples generated by the processor).

(4) Parameter context NOTES:
Set "broker-port" to the context broker NGSI-LD API port e.g. 9090 (for scorpio scenario)

(1) Parameter context NOTES:
Create new parameter context. Apply context to all executed process groups

(3) Parameter context NOTES:
Set "broker-name" to the container service name e.g. scorpio (for scorpio scenario) or orion

(6) IMPORTANT:
Remember to enable all the controller services
Clear all unnecesary attributes generated by processors for a better debugging and routing
Clear all unnecesary attributes generated by processors for a better debugging and routing
404 - NOT FOUND
Create entity in broker
Transform timeseries sample into NGSI-LD format.
Create "FlowFileContentCopy" attribute with a copy of the FlowFIle content. We are going to try to update existing entity in Scorpio or create it if fails
Clear unnecesary json fields for updating operation
Try to update existing entity
Create "entity-id" attribute with the ID extracted from content
Restore original content from "FlowFileContentCopy" attribute
